# Data Assembly Process

[VegVault]{.text-background-black .text-color-white .text-bold} v1.0.0 has been assembled through systematic integration of multiple publicly available databases, each contributing specialized data types to create a comprehensive vegetation database spanning both temporal and ecological dimensions.

### Primary Data Sources

1. **[Neotoma Paleoecology Database](https://www.neotomadb.org/)** - [Fossil pollen data]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold} (0-20,000 years BP)
2. **[sPlotOpen](https://idiv-biodiversity.de/en/splot/splotopen.html)** - [Contemporary vegetation plots]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold}  
3. **[BIEN](https://bien.nceas.ucsb.edu/bien/)** - [Contemporary vegetation]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold} and [functional traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}
4. **[TRY Plant Trait Database](https://www.try-db.org/TryWeb/Home.php)** - Comprehensive [plant functional traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}
5. **[CHELSA](https://chelsa-climate.org/)** - High-resolution [climate data]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (contemporary and paleoclimate)
6. **[WoSIS](https://www.isric.org/explore/wosis)** - Global [soil property data]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold}

## Assembly Details of VegVault 1.0.0

[VegVault]{.text-background-black .text-color-white .text-bold} version 1.0.0 has been assembled through systematic integration of multiple publicly available databases, each contributing specialized data types to create a comprehensive vegetation database spanning both temporal and ecological dimensions.

### Assembly Process Overview

The assembly workflow visualization:

```{r}
#| label: VV assembly scheme
knitr::include_graphics(
  here::here(
    "Outputs/Figures/DB_assembly_visualisation/assembly_viz_04.png"
  )
)

```

**Key Assembly Steps:**

1. **Data Acquisition**: Raw data obtained from primary sources
2. **Data Processing**: Individual processing pipelines for each data type using specialized [GitHub repositories]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-white .text-bold}
3. **[Taxonomic Harmonization]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}**: Using the {taxospace} R package to align taxa with GBIF backbone
4. **[Trait Categorization]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}**: Grouping [traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} into functional domains following [Díaz et al. (2016)](https://doi.org/10.1038/nature16489)
5. **Spatial-Temporal Linking**: Creating gridpoints for [abiotic data]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold} and linking to [vegetation samples]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold}
6. **[Database Integration]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold}**: Consolidation into unified [SQLite database]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} structure

### [Reproducibility]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-white .text-bold} Through Version Control

All [VegVault]{.text-background-black .text-color-white .text-bold} processing repositories use [GitHub Tags](https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/releasing-projects-on-github/viewing-your-repositorys-releases-and-tags) to ensure complete [reproducibility]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-white .text-bold}. The specific tagged versions used for v1.0.0 are documented in both our code and documentation, enabling exact replication of the [database assembly]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} process.

### Processing Repositories

**Specialized Processing Pipelines:**

- **[VegVault-FOSSILPOL v1.0.0](https://github.com/OndrejMottl/VegVault-FOSSILPOL/tree/v1.0.0)** - [Fossil pollen data]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold} processing
- **[VegVault-Vegetation_data v1.1.0](https://github.com/OndrejMottl/VegVault-Vegetation_data/tree/v1.1.0)** - [Contemporary vegetation]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold} processing  
- **[VegVault-Trait_data v1.1.0](https://github.com/OndrejMottl/VegVault-Trait_data/tree/v1.1.0)** - [Functional trait data]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} processing
- **[VegVault-abiotic_data v1.1.0](https://github.com/OndrejMottl/VegVault-abiotic_data/tree/v1.1.0)** - [Environmental data]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold} processing
- **[VegVault v1.0.0](https://github.com/OndrejMottl/VegVault/tree/v1.0.0-zenodo)** - Final [database integration]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold}

## Data Processing Details

### [Fossil Pollen Records]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold}

[Fossil pollen records]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold} have been downloaded from the [Neotoma Paleoecology Database](https://www.neotomadb.org/) using their API on 26th June 2023. All data acquisition and processing have been done using the [FOSSILPOL: Workflow for processing and standardizing global paleoecological pollen data](https://bit.ly/FOSSILPOL) (version 1.0.0). This includes the selection of depositional environments, ecological groups, chronology control point types, and a minimum number of chronology control points to construct age-depth models. Individual samples and records have been filtered by age limits, number of [pollen grains]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold}, maximum age interpolation, and number of valid levels. In addition, the accuracy of [fossil pollen data]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold} is increased by re-estimating all age-depth models using the Bayesian probabilistic approach and including the information about individual age uncertainty.

**Selection Criteria:**

- Only records with type "pollen" with valid geological coordinates (longitude between -180 and 180, latitude between -90 and 90)
- Depositional environments: lakes, bogs, and mires only ([selection table](https://github.com/OndrejMottl/VegVault-FOSSILPOL/blob/v1.0.0-zenodo/Data/Input/Depositional_environment/Neotoma/depositional_environment_selection_2023-06-26.csv))
- Specific ecological groups retained ([selection table](https://github.com/OndrejMottl/VegVault-FOSSILPOL/blob/v1.0.0-zenodo/Data/Input/Eco_group/eco_group_2023-06-28.csv))
- Minimum 5 chronology control points ([valid types](https://github.com/OndrejMottl/VegVault-FOSSILPOL/blob/v1.0.0-zenodo/Data/Input/Chronology_setting/Chron_control_point_types/chron_control_point_types_2023-06-28.csv))

**Quality Filters:**

- Minimum 125 [pollen grains]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold} per sample (balanced for data retention vs. quality)
  - While the preferred minimum was initially set at 150, this threshold resulted in significant data loss
  - Threshold adjusted to 125 with condition that less than 75% of samples would have low pollen sum
- Age limits: 0-20,000 cal yr BP
- Exclusion of samples older than 3000 years of the last chronology control point
- Minimum 5 samples per record
- Re-calculated age-depth models using Bayesian approach ({Bchron} package)

**Processing Details**: Available at [VegVault-FOSSILPOL](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.14745060)

### [Contemporary Vegetation Plots]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold}

The primary sources of [contemporary plot-based vegetation data]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold} are BIEN (Botanical Information and Ecology Network) and sPlotOpen (the open-access version of sPlot).

**BIEN Processing:**

- Downloaded using {RBIEN} R package v1.2.7 on 2nd August 2023 using function `BIEN::BIEN_plot_datasource()`
- Retained key columns: "datasource_id", "datasource", "plot_name", "sampling_protocol", "methodology_reference", "methodology_description", "longitude", "latitude", "plot_area_ha", "subplot", "individual_count", "family_matched", "name_matched", "name_matched_author", "verbatim_family", "verbatim_scientific_name", "scrubbed_species_binomial", "scrubbed_taxonomic_status", "scrubbed_family", "scrubbed_author"
- All columns renamed using "snake_style"
- Filtered out records with missing essential information (NA values in "datasource_id", "datasource", "plot_name", "longitude", "latitude", and/or "plot_area_ha")

**sPlotOpen Processing:**

- Downloaded sPlotOpen v2.0 on 26th September 2023
- Linked tables "DT2.oa" and "header.oa" via "PlotObservationID" column
- Applied quality filters for geographic and area data (filtered out rows with NA values in "PlotObservationID", "GIVD_ID", "Longitude", "Latitude", and/or "Releve_area")
- All columns renamed using "snake_style"

**Processing Details**: Available at [VegVault-Vegetation_data](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.16729978)

### [Functional Traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}

Following [Díaz et al. (2016)](https://doi.org/10.1038/nature16489), we selected six key [functional traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} representing:

- [Stem specific density]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}
- [Leaf nitrogen content per unit mass]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}  
- [Diaspore mass]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}
- [Plant height]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}
- [Leaf area]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}
- [Leaf mass per area]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}

**[TRY Database]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} Processing:**

- Data request ID: 28498 on 29th August 2023
- Requested [traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} with codes: 3106, 4, 3108, 3110, 3112, 3114, 3116, 3117, 14, and 26 (closest to Díaz et al. 2016 description)
- Used {rtry} R package v1.1.0 for data import
- For each [trait]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} ("TraitID"), extracted all relevant observations ("ObservationID"), ensuring only observations unique to each [trait]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}
- Identified all unique data ("DataID") associated with each [trait]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}
- Excluded non-meaningful [trait]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} variations (DataID: 2221, 2222, 2223, 2224, 2225, 3646, 3647, 3698, 3699, 3727, 3728, 3730, 3731, 3849, 3850, 4029, and 4030), e.g., height at 15 days
- Extracted covariate information (additional data stored in "DataName" column)
- All columns renamed using "snake_style"
- Added "[Trait Domain]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}" variable to group [traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} following Díaz et al. (2016) selection for efficient extraction across TRY and BIEN

**[BIEN Traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} Processing:**

- Downloaded using {RBIEN} R package v1.2.7 on 15th December 2023 using function `BIEN::BIEN_trait_trait()`
- Requested [traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}: "[whole plant height]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}", "[stem wood density]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}", "[leaf area]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}", "[leaf area per leaf dry mass]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}", "[leaf nitrogen content per leaf dry mass]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}", and "[seed mass]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}"
- Retained columns: "trait_name", "trait_value", "unit", "id", "longitude", "latitude", "method", "url_source", "source_citation", "project_pi", "scrubbed_species_binomial", and "access"
- Calculated derived measures (e.g., [leaf mass per area]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} = 1/[leaf area per leaf dry mass]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold})

**Processing Details**: Available at [VegVault-Trait_data](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.14745086)

### [Abiotic Environmental Data]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold}

The primary sources of [abiotic data]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold} are CHELSA, CHELSA-TRACE21, and WoSIS Soil Profile Database. The first two data sources provide high-resolution downscaled [climatic data]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold}, while the latter offers detailed [soil information]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (only available for [contemporary data]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold}).

**[CHELSA Climate Data]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold}:**

- [Contemporary]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold}: CHELSA v2.1 downloaded on 8th September 2023
- Used {ClimDatDownloadR} R package with function `ClimDatDownloadR::Chelsa.Clim.download()`
- Selected bio-variables: 1, 4, 6, 12, 15, 18, 19
- Spatial aggregation: 25x factor using median values with {terra} R package function `terra::aggregate(factor = 25, fun = "median")`

**[Paleoclimate]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold}: CHELSA-TRACE21**

- [Paleoclimate]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold}: CHELSA-TRACE21 v1.0 downloaded on 31st December 2023
- Downloaded values for each 500-year time-slice between 0 and 18,000 years before present (BP)
- Selected bio-variables: 1, 4, 6, 12, 15, 18, 19
- For each time slice, applied spatial aggregation using `terra::aggregate(factor = 25, fun = "median")`

**[WoSIS Soil Data]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold}:**

- Downloaded on 11th September 2023 (both HWSD2_RASTER.zip and HWSD2_DB.zip)
- Extracted [soil type names]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (column "HWSD2_SMU_ID") by combining tables "HWSD2_SMU" and "D_WRB4"
- Added [soil type information]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold} to the raster
- [Resampled]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-black .text-bold} using `terra::resample(method = "near")` function to match [climate data]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold} resolution
- Provides essential [edaphic context]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold} for vegetation-environment relationships ([contemporary data]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold} only)

**Processing Details**: Available at [VegVault-abiotic_data](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.14745293)

## [Data Integration Procedures]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-black .text-bold}

All [processing pipelines]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-black .text-bold} with their corresponding [Tags]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} are migrated into an [SQLite database]{.text-background-black .text-color-white .text-bold} using the GitHub repository titled [VegVault](https://github.com/OndrejMottl/VegVault/tree/v1.0.0-zenodo), which can be accessed as DOI: [10.5281/zenodo.15201994](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.15201994).

### [Data Migration Details]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-black .text-bold}

**[Migrating sPlotOpen vegetation data]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold}:**
- [Dataset name]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (dataset_name) created from "plot_observation_id" as "splot_[plot_observation_id]"
- Original [data source]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} from column "givd_id" stored in [DatasetSourcesID]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} table
- [Sample name]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (sample_name) created using "plot_observation_id" as "splot_[plot_observation_id]"
- [Sample Size]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (sample_size) created from "releve_area" column
- All samples automatically assigned age of 0
- Taxonomic names extracted from "Species" column, abundances from "Original_abundance"

**Migrating BIEN vegetation data:**
- [Dataset name]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (dataset_name) created as "bien_[row number]"
- Original [data source]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} from column "datasource" stored in [DatasetSourcesID]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} table
- [Sampling method]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-black .text-bold} extracted from "methodology_description" column
- [Sample name]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (sample_name) created as "bien_[row number]"
- [Sample Size]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (sample_size) created from "plot_area_ha" column, multiplied by 10,000 (stored in square meters)
- All samples automatically assigned [age of 0]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold}
- [Taxonomic names]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} extracted from "name_matched" column

**[Migrating fossil pollen data]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold}:**
- [Dataset name]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (dataset_name) created from "dataset_id" (fossilpol_[dataset_id])
- Note: column "dataset_id" from primary source does not match "dataset_id" in [VegVault]{.text-background-black .text-color-white .text-bold}
- Original [data source]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} from "source_of_data" column stored in [DatasetSourcesID]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} table
- [Sampling method]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-black .text-bold} extracted from "depositionalenvironment" column
- Individual [Dataset Reference]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} extracted from "doi" column
- [Sample name]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (sample_name) created using "dataset_id" and "sample_id" as "fossilpol_[dataset_id]_[sample_id]"
- [Ages]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold} extracted from "levels" column
- [Age uncertainty]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold} from age-depth models extracted from "age_uncertainty" column
- [Taxonomic names]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} and [abundances]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold} extracted from "counts_harmonised" column

**[Migrating TRY functional traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}:**
- [Dataset name]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (dataset_name) created as "try_[row number]"
- Original [data source]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} from column "dataset" stored in [DatasetSourcesID]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} table
- Individual [Dataset Reference]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} extracted from "reference_source" column
- [Sample name]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (sample_name) created as "try_[row number]"
- Individual [Sample reference]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} extracted from "dataset_reference_citation"
- All samples automatically assigned [age of 0]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold}
- Trait names extracted from "trait_full_name", taxonomic names from "acc_species_name", trait values from "trait_value"

**[Migrating BIEN functional traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}:**
- [Dataset name]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (dataset_name) created as "bien_traits_[row number]"
- Original [data source]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} from column "project_pi" stored in [DatasetSourcesID]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} table
- Individual [Dataset Reference]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} extracted from "source_citation" column
- [Sample name]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (sample_name) created using column "id" as "bien_traits_[id]"

- [Trait names]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} extracted from "trait_name", [taxonomic names]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} from "scrubbed_species_binomial", [trait values]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} from "trait_value"
- [Trait]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} "leaf mass per area" calculated from "leaf area per leaf dry mass" as 1/value

### [Final Database Integration Procedures]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-black .text-bold}

In addition to the consolidation of all [processed data]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-black .text-bold} into a unified [SQLite database]{.text-background-black .text-color-white .text-bold}, the final [VegVault]{.text-background-black .text-color-white .text-bold} migration repository performs three critical procedures to ensure [data consistency]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-black .text-bold} and usability:

#### (i) [Taxonomic Classification]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}

As [VegVault]{.text-background-black .text-color-white .text-bold} integrates data on [taxa]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} from various sources, the [{taxospace}]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-black .text-bold} R package is used to classify diverse [taxa]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} into a unifying [taxonomic backbone]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}. The [{taxospace}]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-black .text-bold} tool automatically aligns [taxon names]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} with the [GBIF taxonomical backbone]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}. Specifically, we find the best match of raw [taxon names]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} using the Global Names Resolver, which is then aligned with GBIF. The resulting [taxonomic classification]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} information, detailed up to the family level, is stored for each [taxon]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}, ensuring consistency and facilitating comparative analyses across different datasets.

**Important limitations**: [Taxonomic classification]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} down to the species level is not available for each [taxon]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (e.g., some [fossil pollen types]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold} can only be identified to the genus or family level). For several [taxa]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}, no matching classification could be found. Note that [taxonomic classification]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} is additional information—the original [taxon name]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} is always present and returned by default. Finally, users should be aware that this classification is an [automated process]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-black .text-bold} and may contain errors.

#### (ii) [Grouping of Traits into Trait Domains]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}

As there are differences in [trait names]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} across data sources (e.g., "Leaf nitrogen (N) content per leaf dry mass" vs. "leaf nitrogen content per leaf dry mass"), we added a new variable `[Trait Domain]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}` that groups [traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} together following the [trait selection]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} of Díaz et al. (2016). For example, [trait]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} "Plant height vegetative" from [TRY]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} and [trait]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} "whole plant height" from [BIEN]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} are both grouped under the "Plant height" [Trait Domain]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}. This grouping serves as an efficient mechanism for extracting comparable [traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} across both [TRY]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} and [BIEN]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold} datasets.

#### (iii) [Creation of Gridpoints for Abiotic Data]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold}

We developed a data structure that provides readily available [environmental context]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold} for each [vegetation]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold} (and [trait]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}) record by creating spatio-temporal links between these records and [abiotic information]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold}. As raster data are not suitable for storage in an [SQLite database]{.text-background-black .text-color-white .text-bold}, we created artificial points, called '[gridpoints]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold}', located in the center of each raster cell. This resulted in a uniform spatio-temporal matrix of [gridpoints]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold} holding the [abiotic information]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold}.

**[Gridpoint naming conventions]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold}**: [Dataset names]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (dataset_name) are created as "geo_[longitude]_[latitude]" and [Sample names]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} (sample_name) are created as "geo_[longitude]_[latitude]_[age]".

**[Spatial-temporal linking]{.text-background-brownLight .text-color-black .text-bold}**: We linked [gridpoints]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold} with other non-gridpoint [Samples]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} ([vegetation_plot]{.text-background-greenLight .text-color-black .text-bold}, [fossil_pollen_archive]{.text-background-purpleLight .text-color-black .text-bold}, and [traits]{.text-background-blueDark .text-color-white .text-bold}) and calculated the spatial and temporal distances between them. We retained any [gridpoint Sample]{.text-background-greenDark .text-color-white .text-bold} within 50 km and/or 5000 years from any other non-gridpoint [Sample]{.text-background-brownDark .text-color-white .text-bold} and discarded the rest.
